phrases.text: Ngồi rằng ngồi tựa i hơ hơ có mấy mạn ối ha ha thuyền là ngồi tựa có mạn thuyền i hi hi i
phrases.english: sit Rang (name) sit lean (particle) warm/roast warm/roast have/there is how many side (boat) oh (exclamation) (exclamation) boat is/be sit lean have/there is side (boat) boat (particle) hey/rare hey/rare (particle)

culturalContext.description: As the opening phrase, this establishes the song's emotional tone and invites audience engagement.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Opening phrases in Vietnamese folk songs often use vocatives (ơi, này) to grab attention before the narrative begins
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
culturalContext.musicalContext: As the opening phrase, it establishes the tonal center and introduces the melodic motif that will be varied throughout.

phrases.text: Trăng in ơ hơ là là mặt nước i i hơ cũng có a càng nhìn là càng nhìn non nước càng xinh ư hư hư ư hư là ôi hư
phrases.english: moon in [?] oh warm/roast is/be is/be face water (particle) (particle) warm/roast also/too have/there is (vocative) more/the more nhìn [?] is/be more/the more nhìn [?] young/tender water more/the more pretty (particle) oh oh (particle) oh is/be oh oh

culturalContext.description: The moon ("trăng") is central to Vietnamese romantic imagery. Separated lovers traditionally looked at the same moon to feel connected across distance.
facts: Vietnamese Mid-Autumn Festival (Tết Trung Thu) celebrates the moon with lion dances, mooncakes, and children's lanterns
The moon appears in Vietnamese proverbs: "Trăng rằm tháng tám" (full moon of 8th month) represents peak beauty
Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches

culturalContext.description: This narrative phrase contributes to the song's narrative structure and emotional arc, typical of Northern folk traditions.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal
culturalContext.musicalContext: Positioned at the song's midpoint, this phrase likely marks a structural pivot or climax in the narrative.

phrases.text: Làm ư hư tài trai hi hi i chơi chốn i hi hơ hư hà là ối a tôi mà tấu hà i i
phrases.english: do/make (particle) oh talent young man hey/rare hey/rare (particle) play place (particle) hey/rare warm/roast oh ha is/be oh (vocative) I/subject that/which perform/report ha (particle) (particle)

culturalContext.description: As the closing phrase, this provides resolution and often returns to opening themes for circular structure.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal
culturalContext.musicalContext: As the closing phrase, it typically returns to the tonic note and may quote the opening melody for circular structure. Exclamatory phrases often use sustained notes or melismatic ornaments (grace notes, bends) to heighten emotional intensity.
